overview_summary: The adjacent landowners are primarily businesses invested in industrial development. These include a national grocery chain building a large distribution center, a data center company that bought land for future facilities, and a local construction supply firm expanding its operations. Most neighbors have recently acquired or developed property in the area, indicating generally pro-development stances and economic interests rather than organized opposition.

neighbors.name: Phi Plp 13 Llc
neighbors.claims: PHI PLP 13 LLC holds an approximately 13.8-acre undeveloped parcel in the Peoria Logistics Park at Northern Ave & 75th Ave【71†L2-L6; "remaining 13.8 acre parcel ... at the northwest corner of Northern and 75th"】. The entity appears to be a land-holding affiliate of the park’s developer (VanTrust Real Estate), with no active operations beyond marketing the site for build-to-suit industrial use ([vantrustrealestate.com](https://vantrustrealestate.com/property/peoria-logistics-park/#:~:text=Peoria%20Logistics%20Park%20is%20a,across%20one%20or%20two%20buildings)). Beneficial owner unknown. No record of political contributions or community activism was found; its role is limited to owning land for future development.
neighbors.influence_justification: Developed 150-acre industrial park; brought major employers (Frito Lay, Trader Joe’s); external developer with limited local roots

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage via VanTrust Real Estate’s local representative (developer of Peoria Logistics Park); position Helpen’s project as a compatible use or tenancy for the remaining parcel to align interests; emphasize speed and credibility given their focus on closing out the park

neighbors.name: Trader Joes Company
neighbors.claims: Trader Joe’s Company (based in Monrovia, CA) purchased 16 acres at Peoria Logistics Park in Dec 2023 to build a 155,000 sq ft refrigerated distribution center, paying $7.1 million cash【72†L21-L29; "Trader Joe’s ...16 acres...paid $7.1 million in cash"】. The facility (under construction as of 2024) will serve the grocer’s regional stores ([vantrustrealestate.com](https://vantrustrealestate.com/new-peoria-logistics-park-fills-up-with-tenants-including-two-major-food-brands/#:~:text=development%20for%20VanTrust%20Real%20Estate%2C,master%20developer%20of%20the%20park)). Trader Joe’s is a privately-held grocery chain ultimately owned by the family of founder Theo Albrecht【62†L1-L4; "Owner | Family of Theo Albrecht"】. The company is not known for local political engagement, focusing instead on efficient operations; no opposition to nearby development is documented.
neighbors.influence_justification: National brand presence with new distribution hub; significant investment and jobs; minimal direct political engagement locally

approach_recommendations.engage: Coordinate with Trader Joe’s facility management early to address any concerns (traffic, infrastructure) impacting their new distribution center; emphasize improvements or stability in local infrastructure that will benefit their logistics operations

neighbors.name: Aligned Data Centers Peoria Prop Co Llc
neighbors.claims: Aligned Data Centers Peoria PropCo LLC (affiliated with Aligned Data Centers of Plano, TX) acquired roughly 80 acres in the Peoria Logistics Park for $43.2 million in October 2024【13†L38-L45; "acquired nearly 80 acres ... for $43.2 million"】. The land purchase from VanTrust positions Aligned for a future data center campus, though specific development plans have not been publicly announced yet ([www.datacenterdynamics.com](https://www.datacenterdynamics.com/en/news/aligned-acquires-land-in-phoenix-arizona/#:~:text=BizJournal%20reports%20that%20Aligned%20this,reached%20out%20for%20more%20information)). Aligned Data Centers already operates at least two large campuses in the Phoenix metro (Phoenix and Glendale) and is expanding its footprint【9†L1-L4; "Aligned Data Centers has added to its presence...two campuses in Phoenix and Glendale"】. The company has substantial financial backing and technical resources, but no record of local political activity; it generally supports growth that ensures robust power and infrastructure for its facilities.
neighbors.influence_justification: Major capital investment ($43M land purchase); global tech infrastructure firm with extensive resources; likely to influence local power and infrastructure planning

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage Aligned’s regional development or facilities director to discuss Helpen’s project in context of supportive infrastructure (e.g., power supply or grid upgrades that could benefit their data center plans); highlight mutual benefits in reliability and sustainability to align with their interests

neighbors.name: Westech Lumber Llc
neighbors.claims: Westech Lumber LLC is a local building materials supplier located at 8525 N 75th Ave in Peoria【39†L16-L24; "Westech Lumber is located at 8525 N 75th Ave in Peoria, AZ"】. It operates as part of Younger Brothers Companies (a major Phoenix-area construction contractor group). In late 2023, Younger Brothers (Westech’s parent) bought ~20 acres adjacent in Peoria Logistics Park for $7.5 million cash to expand its truss and door manufacturing facilities【73†L1-L4; "20 acres ... to Younger Brothers Cos., a truss and door manufacturer ... $7.5 million"】. Westech has been serving Arizona’s construction industry since 2009【42†L51-L57; "Westech has been proudly serving ... since our inception in 2009"】 and maintains strong ties with local builders. No evidence of any anti-development stance; the company benefits from and actively participates in growth (supplying materials to new projects).
neighbors.influence_justification: Embedded in local construction sector; moderate local employer; recently invested in significant expansion land; connected to major homebuilding networks

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage Westech/Younger Brothers leadership informally through local business networks; emphasize how Helpen’s project could drive construction demand (materials, jobs) and commit to minimizing any disruptions to their operations, converting them into potential allies or suppliers

neighbors.name: Westech Components Inc
neighbors.claims: Westech Components Inc appears to be the manufacturing arm of Younger Brothers Companies, focused on building components (e.g. trusses and doors) in Peoria【73†L1-L4; "Younger Brothers Cos., a truss and door manufacturer"】. The company (via Younger Brothers) purchased roughly 20 acres of land in 2023 at the Peoria Logistics Park for $7.5 million to construct a new production facility, indicating a commitment to local expansion【73†L1-L4; "20 acres ... $7.5 million ... in all cash"】. As part of the Westech brand, it has served the Phoenix area construction market since 2009 ([www.youngerbrothers.com](https://www.youngerbrothers.com/westech#:~:text=Westech%20Building%20Supplies%20,our%20inception%20in%202009%2C%20we%E2%80%99ve)). Westech Components/Younger Brothers is growth-oriented and stands to gain from increased development (through supplying building components); it has no record of opposing development projects. Its ownership is private (family-owned) with no public political activities noted.
neighbors.influence_justification: Growing manufacturing presence in city; tied into local development industry; privately held with local networks; recent significant land acquisition

approach_recommendations.engage: Connect with Younger Brothers’ management overseeing the new manufacturing site; stress that Helpen’s plans could support or utilize their products/services. Building a collaborative relationship (e.g., sourcing materials locally) can turn them into proponents and mitigate any concerns about increased competition for labor or utilities
